Kotlin.description: Modern programming language officially supported for Android development, designed to be concise and safe.

Java.description: General-purpose, object-oriented programming language widely used in Android and enterprise applications.

JavaScript.description: High-level scripting language primarily used for web development and dynamic client-side interactions.

Jetpack Compose.description: Modern declarative UI toolkit for building native Android user interfaces with Kotlin.

CameraX.description: Jetpack support library for camera development that simplifies camera features on Android.

Dagger.description: Compile-time dependency injection framework for Java and Android applications.

Hilt.description: Dependency injection library built on top of Dagger, designed to simplify DI in Android apps.

Koin.description: Lightweight dependency injection framework for Kotlin developers.

Coroutines.description: Kotlin concurrency framework for asynchronous programming and structured concurrency.

Flows.description: Kotlin Flow provides cold asynchronous data streams built on coroutines.

Gradle.description: Build automation tool commonly used in Android projects to manage dependencies and build logic.

MVVM.description: Software architectural pattern that separates concerns into Model, View, and ViewModel for maintainable apps.

MVP.description: Software architectural pattern separating Model, View, and Presenter, often used in older Android projects.

Retrofit.description: Type-safe HTTP client for Android and Java for interacting with REST APIs.

ViewBinding.description: Feature in Android to more easily write code that interacts with views.

DataBinding.description: Android library that binds UI components in layouts to data sources using declarative format.

Material 3.description: Latest iteration of Google's Material Design system for building modern Android UI.

ExoPlayer.description: Media playback library for Android supporting audio, video, and adaptive streaming.

Clean Architecture.description: Architectural approach emphasizing separation of concerns and independence of frameworks, UI, and databases.

Jetpack Navigation.description: Android Jetpack component that manages app navigation and back stack handling.

Custom Views.description: User-defined Android views built to implement specialized UI elements beyond standard widgets.

Backend.description: General term for server-side systems that support client applications with APIs and business logic.

Node.js.description: JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, commonly used for backend development.

Spring Boot.description: Java framework for building stand-alone, production-grade backend applications.

REST APIs.description: Architectural style for building networked applications using stateless operations over HTTP.

Github Actions.description: CI/CD automation platform integrated with GitHub for building, testing, and deploying code.

Azure.description: Microsoft cloud platform offering compute, storage, and application services.

Appcenter.description: Microsoft App Center provides build, test, distribute, and analytics services for apps.

Fastlane.description: Open source platform for automating Android and iOS deployment pipelines.

Git.description: Distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code.

GitHub.description: Code hosting platform for version control and collaboration using Git.

GitLab.description: Web-based DevOps lifecycle tool providing Git repository management and CI/CD.

Bitbucket.description: Git-based code hosting and collaboration platform by Atlassian.

JIRA.description: Project management and issue-tracking tool developed by Atlassian.

Figma.description: Collaborative interface design tool for creating and prototyping user experiences.

Zeplin.description: Design collaboration tool for sharing finalized UI designs with developers.

Analytics.description: Tools and practices for collecting and analyzing app usage data.

Crashlytics.description: Firebase crash reporting tool for real-time crash analytics.

Hosting.description: Firebase service for deploying web apps and static content with fast global delivery.

Push Notifications.description: Firebase Cloud Messaging enables sending targeted notifications to users across platforms.

App Distribution.description: Firebase service for distributing pre-release app builds to testers.

Cloud Functions.description: Serverless backend logic triggered by Firebase features and HTTPS requests.

Realtime DB.description: Firebase's original NoSQL cloud-hosted database for syncing data in real-time.

Firestore.description: Firebase's scalable NoSQL cloud database for mobile, web, and server apps.

Authentication.description: Firebase Authentication provides backend services for easy user authentication.

Remote Config.description: Firebase service that lets you change app behavior and appearance without app updates.
